==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=n|rs=鼎00}}
[[File:Liu_Ding.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|鼎}} (''kanae'', ''tei''): ceremonial tripod kettle]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[ちょう]] (chō)
|kanon=[[てい]] (tei)
|kun=[[かなえ]] (kanae)
|nanori=[[かね]] (kane)
}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|かなえ|yomi=kun}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かなえ|金|tr1=kana|t1=metal|瓮|tr2=he|t2=a pot or pan for holding food or beverages}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|か|なえ}}<ref name="DJR"/><ref name="SMK">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ka̠na̠e̞]}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|釜}} {{qualifier|less common}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かなえ|hhira=かなへ}}

# a three-legged [[kettle]], a [[tripod]] kettle, used for [[cooking]] and later for [[ceremonial]] purposes in ancient China, and often made of [[bronze]]
# a [[symbol]] of a [[king]] or other high [[authority]]

=====Idioms=====
* {{ja-r|鼎の軽重を問う|かなえ の けいじゅう を とう}}: "to ask about the weight of a kettle" ⇒ to [[question]] a person's [[ability]]
* {{ja-r|鼎の沸くが如し|かなえ の わく が ごとし}}: "just like a boiling kettle" ⇒ a metaphor for a noisy busy situation
* {{ja-r|鼎の中の一切れの肉|かなえ の なか の ひときれ の にく}}: "single slice of meat [from] in the kettle" ⇒ to get a read on the whole from a small sample
* {{ja-r|鼎を扛ぐ|かなえ を あぐ}}: "to lift a kettle" ⇒ to be physically strong
* {{ja-r|鼎を定む|かなえ を さだむ}}: "to settle the kettle" ⇒ to control the imperial capital, to ascend the throne

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|てい|yomi=on}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=てい}} {{m|ltc|鼎|tr=*děng}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|鼎|tr=dǐng}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|a|て|い}}<ref name="DJR"/>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[te̞ː]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|てい}}

# a three-legged [[kettle]], a [[tripod]] kettle, used for [[cooking]] and later for [[ceremonial]] purposes in ancient China, and often made of [[bronze]]
# one of the [[I Ching]] [[hexagram]]s
